thread.title: "Bachelor" couple visit Houston for Origins grand reopening
thread.title_full: "Bachelor" couple visit Houston for Origins grand reopening

author: Amber Elliott
title: "Bachelor" couple visit Houston for Origins grand reopening
text:
"Bachelor" couple visit Houston for Origins grand reopening By Amber Elliott Updated 4:57 pm, Friday, October 23, 2015 Photo: Elizabeth Conley, Houston Chronicle Image 1 of / 12 Close Image 1 of 12 The Bachelor reality television show stars, Catherine and Sean Lowe talks about Origins products and Houston during the opening of a new concept store Origins in the Galleria. The Bachelor reality television show stars, Catherine and Sean Lowe talks about Origins products and Houston during the opening of a new concept store Origins in the Galleria. Photo: Elizabeth Conley, Houston Chronicle Image 2 of 12 Catherine and Sean Lowe of Season 17 of "The Bachelor," greet fans during the opening of a new concept store Origins in The Galleria. Catherine and Sean Lowe of Season 17 of "The Bachelor," greet fans during the opening of a new concept store Origins in The Galleria. Photo: Elizabeth Conley, Houston Chronicle Image 3 of 12 Catherine and Sean Lowe pose for a photo with fans Shanna Jones, left, and Felice Sloan, second from right, of Houston. Catherine and Sean Lowe pose for a photo with fans Shanna Jones, left, and Felice Sloan, second from right, of Houston. Photo: Elizabeth Conley, Houston Chronicle Image 4 of 12 A display of samples at Origins in The Galleria. A display of samples at Origins in The Galleria. Photo: Elizabeth Conley, Houston Chronicle Image 5 of 12 SVP and GM of Origins, Stéphane De La Faverie, talks about his products. SVP and GM of Origins, Stéphane De La Faverie, talks about his products. Photo: Elizabeth Conley, Houston Chronicle Image 6 of 12 The Bachelor reality television show stars, Catherine and Sean Lowe talks about Origins products. The Bachelor reality television show stars, Catherine and Sean Lowe talks about Origins products. Photo: Elizabeth Conley, Houston Chronicle Image 7 of 12 The Bachelor reality television show stars, Catherine and Sean Lowe try home-made rosewater marshmallows. The Bachelor reality television show stars, Catherine and Sean Lowe try home-made rosewater marshmallows. Photo: Elizabeth Conley, Houston Chronicle Image 8 of 12 A display of reality television star Catherine Lowe's favorite Origins products. A display of reality television star Catherine Lowe's favorite Origins products. SVP and GM of Origins, Stéphane De La Faverie, talks about his products. Photo: Elizabeth Conley, Houston Chronicle Image 10 of 12 Sean Lowe and the former Catherine Giudici married after connecting on the reality show "The Bachelor." Sean Lowe and the former Catherine Giudici married after connecting on the reality show "The Bachelor." Photo: Dave Hagerman, ABC Image 11 of 12 Sean Lowe was the bachelor handing out red roses on Season 17 of "The Bachelor" reality show on ABC. Sean Lowe was the bachelor handing out red roses on Season 17 of "The Bachelor" reality show on ABC. Photo: Kevin Foley, ABC "Bachelor" couple visit Houston for Origins grand reopening 1 / 12 Back to Gallery 
Catherine Lowe, the winner of ABC's "The Bachelor" season 17, made her first trip to Houston on Friday for the Origins store grand reopening inside The Galleria. She and husband Sean Lowe welcomed 50 fans and 20 beauty bloggers to the unveiling of the lifestyle brand's new discovery retail concept. 
"The consumer wants more storytelling and a more interactive experience," said Stéphane De La Faverie, senior vice president and general manager of Origins, while carrying trays of juices and small bites from True Food Kitchen swirled around him. "The company is celebrating its 25th anniversary this year, and Houston is the first of many rebranded stores." 
Catherine explained that Origins has tapped into what she's always valued in a beauty brand, "Natural ingredients, pretty packaging and giving back to the community." 
Indeed, Origins has partnered with Global ReLeaf, a project which supports the restoration of forests, and replanted more than 600,000 trees globally since 2009 in conjunction with the Lower Rio Grande Valley National Wildlife Refuge. 
Although the new concept reveal marked Catherine's first trip to the Bayou City, Sean visited a friend recently in The Woodlands. This time around, the couple stayed at the nearby Hotel Derek and binged on prosciutto pizza. 
"The next logical step for us is ... babies!" Sean revealed. "We just don't know when yet." 
Catherine shared that she's also looking forward to holiday travel. The reality television stars are planning a trip to her hometown of Seattle so that she can spend time with her sisters. 
"We went to Hawaii three weeks ago," Catherine said. "I'm trying to convince Sean to take me back a few times a year from here on out." Entertainment News
